summary:
The NCAA is a nonprofit group that oversees sports for about 1,100 U.S. and Canadian schools. It helps manage college sports and supports over 500,000 student athletes. The NCAA divides schools into three divisions based on size. Divisions I and II can give sports scholarships, but Division III cannot.

The NCAA has faced criticism for limiting the money college athletes can earn. Economists believe these rules benefit schools more than the athletes. In 2021, the U.S. Supreme Court agreed, saying some NCAA restrictions break antitrust laws. Recently, the NCAA agreed to pay Division I athletes who have played since 2016.
title: National Collegiate Athletic Association
